p: Experimental evidence suggested that learning and memory impairment in mouse could be improved by 6-shogaol both in vitro and in vivo. 6-Shogaol decreased the levels of CysLT1R/cathepsin B and amyloid-beta in the brain of mice. Therefore, 6-shogaol may be beneficial for treating AD due to its role as a CysLT1R and cathepsin B inhibitor [ 34]. Further research showed that 6-gingerol activated Akt activity and inhibited GSK-3 β activity, thereby protecting PC12 cells against Aβ 1−42-induced apoptosis through the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3 β signaling pathway, suggesting that 6-gingerol may be one of the effective intervention measures for AD [ 35].
